basics.name: James Benedict
basics.label: Reporter and developer
basics.summary: tl;dr Journalist who <3 computers can build you cool visuals

work.summary: Worked on an investigative series about Taser usage for the national desk. Helped populate a database with original reporting and cowrote a story in the series. Conducted interviews, gathered primary documents and researched using media/legal databases. Fact checked and confirmed accuracy of legal complaints and local reporting.

Reported on HIV medication shortages and issues with patient records. Started reporting days after President Museveni's controversial fifth inauguration and formation of a new government. Spoke with sources ranging from Museveni's personal doctor and senior advisor to the fisherfolk. Wrote, photographed and developed my story across multiple locations in Uganda. Studied at African Centre for Media Excellence. Fell in love with Kalangala and am trying to convince others the 26-hour flight is worth it.

Worked with the editorial, advertising and a contracted CMS provider to redesign the website. Focused on improving UI and mobile retention. Created multiple mockups and detailed explanatory writeups for submission.
Analyzed and visualized data. Created maps, charts, and custom-built websites. Worked on stories about campaign finance, health care and campus crime.

Managed editors working to produce interactive and social content. Developed in-house software and detailed documentation to address short and long term problems. Managed homepage during breaking news. Oversaw and produced multiple longform digital projects.

Produced interactive graphics, websites and videos. Created specific content for social media and integrated analytics with editorial meetings. Managed homepage during breaking news. Developed a digital style guide and updated homepage styles.
Made news photos and photo illustrations. Made feature photo essays and breaking news photos. Had beats including men's basketball. Toned and selected own photos.

Designed pages for 36-38 Best of News Design Book. Wrote software to aide organizing the 38th book. Facilitated the SND37 and 38 contest and helped select entries that went into the book. Help manage organization as president and treasurer
Managed the club and organized designers for the SND38 Book. Accounted for over $10 thousand of funds.
Helped students create media with adobe suite, web development software, and final cut pro. Instructed students and staff how to best use photo/video equipment.
Setup a new domain, installed wordpress, and migrated content from the previous site. Trained the staff how to operate it.

awards.title: Photo Illustration, 1st
awards.awarder: Columbia Scholastic Press Association Gold Circle

awards.title: News Feature - Digital Media, 1st
awards.awarder: Columbia Scholastic Press Association Gold Circle
